THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN NORMAN HAS ISSUED A WINTER
WEATHER ADVISORY...WHICH IS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 6
AM CST FRIDAY. A WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9
AM CST THIS MORNING.

* TIMING: PERIODS OF SNOW ARE EXPECTED THROUGH MID-MORNING BEFORE
  DISSIPATING. A SECOND ROUND OF PRECIPITATION...WHICH WILL BE
  SLEET AND/OR FREEZING RAIN IS EXPECTED FROM EARLY THURSDAY
  MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY NIGHT.

* MAIN IMPACT: THIS MORNING...A LIGHT GLAZING OF ICE AND UP TO ONE
  INCH OF SNOW. HIGHER SNOW TOTALS...ON THE ORDER OF A COUPLE OF
  INCHES...IS POSSIBLE NEAR AND JUST NORTH OF BENJAMIN...
  SEYMOUR... AND ARCHER CITY TEXAS. WITH THE SECOND ROUND OF
  PRECIPITATION...AREAS OF ACCUMULATING SLEET AND/OR FREEZING RAIN
  ARE EXPECTED.

* OTHER IMPACTS: SLICK SPOTS ON AREA ROADWAYS HAVE ALREADY BEEN
  REPORTED...ESPECIALLY ON BRIDGES AND OVERPASSES.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

BE CAREFUL IF YOU HAVE TO TRAVEL. EVEN SMALL AMOUNTS OF ICE AND
SNOW CAN MAKE ROADS AND SIDEWALKS SLICK AND DANGEROUS.
